name: Beverly Hills Hotel

reviews.text: Why the Beverly Hills Hotel ? I was greeted by name in reception, in the lounge , in the Sugar Club and at the pool. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet has the freshest seasonal fruit and juices. The buffet also has an abundance of cold meats and smoked salmon. The hot breakfast includes a variety of eggs, meats, fish and a range of vegetarian accompaniments. The food in the Sugar Club is absolutely fantastic. The staff, including the general manager, reception, concierge, dining areas, pool and housekeeping go oit of their way to make one stay absolutely enjoyable.
reviews.title: Fantastic view, service and cuisine - that's The Beverly Hills Hotel

reviews.text: Not wanting to burst some of the reviewers' lavish praise bubbles hovering over this hotel, I'd like to present perhaps a more realistic point of view, having stayed here many times. Firstly, the management has changed often over the last three years - not a good sign at all. Then, the rooms, specially the more expensive lower cabana's are in critical need of restoration. The airconditioning leaks badly. The patios are cracked and unsightly. The paint is peeling off and the minor furniture refurbishments are now well past their sell-by-date. And, there are glaring electrical problems. The rooms in the main building are small, but pleasant with dirty little balconies. Don't get coaxed into a room in the middle of the floor, because these are the smallest, with bathrooms that only slighlty outdo telephone booths for size. The upper cabana's are better designed with better bathrooms, but only offer queen beds except for cabana 10 [two bedrooms]. Afternoon tea was once an event at theis hotel, but is now simply pathetic. In this regard, the Oysterbox nextdoor puts The Beverly Hills to shame. However, the staff are pleasant, breakfast is good and the pool has been renovated about eighteen months ago. The bottom line is, what you're willing to pay. At a good rate, this hotel becomes acceptable. But too often, guests are extorted.
reviews.title: The truth about this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know for a fact, that many of the hotels' regulars, have refused to come back here, despite the managements overcompensatory pleasantries. These just aren't enough to disguise the fact that this hotel needs an overhaul. And while they're at it, they could look at what they think passes for food at their poolside cafe. It is just sub standard. I wonder what Sol Kerzner would do to if he were asked to help this hotel return to the standard of style and luxury it once maintained when he first openned its doors decades ago.
reviews.title: The Amazing Beverly Hills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My experience at the Beverly Hills Hotel was the best hotel experience I have had to date. All of my expectations were exceeded with class and style. I was blown away by the warm, classy hospitality.
reviews.title: New Year's Eve at BH

reviews.text: Location: The hotel is located on the beautiful Umhlanga beach front with quick access to Durban and surrounding areas. Every room is positioned with a balcony facing the sea with amazing views of the lighthouse and pier. The gentle sea breeze and the sound of waves hitting the shore put me into a holiday mood immediately. The hotel has a classic traditional feel to it suitable for individuals or families. The interior is amazing with luxurious lounges and indoor as well as outdoor dining.
reviews.title: Fantastic View and Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent my honeymoon at this hotel. It is well located at the foot of the Umhlanga Beach and positioned in a vibey area. There are lots of restaurants in the surrounding areas, and the Gateway shopping mall is also close by. Perfect family holiday spoil hotel.
reviews.title: Luxury at the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent my wedding night at this hotel before flying out on honeymoon. Excellent is all I can say. Whilst we didn't stay long the service was outstanding especially as we arrived after midnight. Add to this the special turn down in the room as well as the complimentary champagne and fruits and cream which impressed me.
reviews.title: Honeymoon

reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Durban

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel in Durban. Every room comes with a balcony facing the ocean. Delightful breakfast spread. Good security. My fav was a Nespresso machine in every room and the hotel isn't stingy with the coffee pods at all. Plus free wifi in the rooms
reviews.title: Great service, great location

reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend away. We were unsure of whether to stay here or at The Oyster Box hotel next door. We're glad we think we made the right decision. We went to The Oyster Box one nigh for dinner and the service at Beverly Hills seems miles ahead.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time that we have stayed at this hotel and the service and friendlyness of
reviews.title: Spoilt Rotten

reviews.text: the staff remains fanatstic. The hotel cannot be faulted in any way! My wife treated me for my
reviews.title: Tremendous Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: birthday and it was a very special experience. The hotel staff made a big fuss and a cake and champagne were put into our room.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts and food are amazing and will ensure that you put on weight! The rooms are very nice and comfortable and all have great sea views.
reviews.title: An amazing experience

reviews.text: This hotel is highly recommended!
reviews.title: A celebration to remember !

reviews.text: What a hotel...clean, spacious, amazing view over the Indian ocean. Great service, clean water, complimentary fruit, nespresso and wine - I am a VERY high standards customer - this hotel ticked every box for me.
reviews.title: Business trip that made my visit to SA

reviews.text: The staff are friendly, courteous and the rooms immaculate.
reviews.title: Not bad at all but not what was expected

reviews.text: The balcony view over the ocean made my trip and I loved sipping coffee in the morning with such a view.
reviews.title: Best service ever

reviews.text: Much cheaper than close rivals - stay here and take advantage of the amenities next door - such as the Indian buffet - the rooms here are worth every penny...
reviews.title: Good but deterioating

reviews.text: I have witnessed this hotel change from its inception in the 60's till today. Overall it is still a very good hotel, however, we found that the rooms were extremely small and the bed in our case consisted of two single beds moved together. The beds were exceptionally comfortable and the bathroom well appointed. The hotel itself is well maintained but the decor is somewhat dated. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It seemed to cater to much more of a senior age group and was quite empty at the time we stayed there.
reviews.title: Outstanding

description: Umhlanga Rocks is one of South Africa’s premier leisure destinations. Boasting glorious weather, loads of attractions and glorious golden beaches it’s easy to understand why. For luxurious holiday accommodation and all rooms facing the indian Ocean,the Beverly Hills Hotel, with its picture perfect setting and marvelous facilities, is the hotel for discerning travelers. Step in side and you will sense you have arrived at a very special place. A landmark iconic hotel renown for professional intuitive service
